intro: Vanheerdea divergens, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. It typically grows in open grasslands and is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Vanheerdea divergens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
